article.title: Refined estimates for the propagation speed of the transition solution to a free boundary problem with a nonlinearity of combustion type

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the function f(u) represent in the free boundary problem described by equation (1.1)?
What does condition (1.3) imply about the function f(u) in the context of combustion?
choices: f(u) is strictly increasing for all u.
f(u) represents a fuel source that ignites at u = 1.
f(u) represents a fuel source with an ignition temperature θ.
f(u) represents heat loss at high temperatures.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the parameter ξo represent in the context of the transition solution to the free boundary problem?
choices: The rate of reaction at the free boundary.
A constant determining the asymptotic behavior of the free boundary.
The critical ignition temperature for the combustion process.
The rate of heat diffusion within the domain.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which type of problem does equation (3.14) represent a solution for?
choices: A nonlinear diffusion problem with a free boundary
A Stefan problem with a constant temperature boundary condition
A heat equation with a source term at the boundary
A wave equation with a moving boundary
